body_html:
@drpngx This problem is still there. I only got no answer how to fix this problem. So as @tensorflowbutler alwais mention: awaiting tensorflower

One solution would be, that the following code is executable in python 3:

from tensorflow.python.util import compat
compat.as_bytes(Path('abc'))

but an argument against it is, that compat.as_bytes has nothing to do with paths.

Another solution would be to use the code that I wrote initially (i.e. swap as_bytes and join), but that would require in python3 that export_dir_base is a str.
os.path.join in python2 does not care about the input type, so there the change will not effect something.

body:
@drpngx This problem is still there. I only got no answer how to fix this problem. So as @tensorflowbutler alwais mention: `awaiting tensorflower`

One solution would be, that the following code is executable in python 3:
```
from tensorflow.python.util import compat
compat.as_bytes(Path('abc'))
```
but an argument against it is, that `compat.as_bytes` has nothing to do with paths.

Another solution would be to use the code that I wrote initially (i.e. swap `as_bytes` and `join`), but that would require in python3 that `export_dir_base` is a `str`. 
`os.path.join` in python2 does not care about the input type, so there the change will not effect something.
